content: simply super bulky hat by anne hurlburt simply super bulky hat is a fast easy pattern for knitters of all ability levels that can be knit in the round in a couple of hours this very warm hat is ideal for a quick gift or for charitable donations use a striped or variegated yarn or add a pom-pom for a different look easily adapted to make a slouchier version or a headband sizes/ finished measurements s small approx 14 circumference unstretched m medium approx 17 circumference unstretched l large approx 20 circumference unstretched yarn super bulky yarn such as lion brand hometown usa line brand wool-ease thick and quick lova fan by scachenmayr approximately 50-70 yards 1 skein of the above yarns will make one hat needle s and notions  us 13/ 9mm or size needed to obtain gauge use 16 circular needle and dpns of same size or knit with magic loop method using a 32 to 47 cable throughout  one stitch marker  tapestry needle gauge 2 5 stitches per inch abbreviations used k = knit st = stitches p = purl k2tog= knit two stitches together directions  cast on 36 42 48 st using long tail method  join to work in round place marker at the beginning of round  ribbing *k1 p1 repeat from * to end work a total of 4 5 5 rounds of ribbing  body work in stockinette stitch knit every stitch until piece measures 5 6 6 from cast on edge  crown round 1 size l only *k6 k2tog repeat from * to end 42 st round 2 size l and m *k5 k2tog repeat from * to end 36 st round 3 size l and m knit round 4 all sizes *k4 k2tog repeat from * to end 30 st round 5 all sizes *k3 k2tog repeat from * to end 24 st round 6 all sizes knit round 7 all sizes *k2 k2tog repeat from * to end 18 st round 8 all sizes *k1 k2tog repeat from * to end 12 st round 9 all sizes *k2tog repeat from * to end 6 st 1  finishing break yarn leaving 8 tail using tapestry needle thread the yarn end through the remaining 6 stitches and draw the stitches together closing the hole weave through one more time then weave end in securely inside the hat weave in end on cast-on edge variations  this pattern can be easily adapted to make a slouchier hat knit for an extra inch or two before starting the crown decreases  the top of this hat is fairly flat but it can be made even flatter by eliminating the plain knit rounds rounds 3 and/or 6 or made more pointy by adding a plain round or two between the decrease rounds  use a self-striping yarn in team colors or add a pom-pom to finish the top standard height size l 6 body taller hat size m
